originalTitle: The king's speech - and why it has foreigners in South Africa worried
title: The king's speech - and why it has foreigners in South Africa worried
content: The Zulu king was trying to calm anti-migrant feelings but ended up using a highly derogatory phrase.

title: More than 200 killed in mine collapse in DR Congo
content: The mine gave way after heavy rains on Wednesday, a local rebel spokesman says.

title: This army chief threatened to castrate opposition leader and claimed descent from Jesus
content: The Ugandan president’s son, notorious for explosive remarks on X, has ambitions to  succeed his father.

title: Alcaraz beats Djokovic to win Australian Open; completes career Slam
content: Alcaraz becomes youngest man to complete tennis career Grand Slam and win seven Slams with a 2-6, 6-2, 6-3, 7-5 triumph.

originalTitle: Starmer’s visit to China was not a reset, but a new way forward
title: Starmer’s visit to China was not a reset, but a new way forward
content: The UK prime minister’s China visit reflects the realities of a new global order that has upended traditional alliances.

originalTitle: As Rafah reopens, Palestinians are ‘given an impossible choice’
title: As Rafah reopens, Palestinians are ‘given an impossible choice’
content: ‘It’s a crime that Palestinians are given an impossible choice.’

title: Takeaways from the millions of newly released Epstein files

title: Rape trial puts Norway's royal family in unwelcome glare of public
content: Marius Borg Høiby, the crown prince's blond stepson, is accused of 38 charges in a case that has attracted global interest.

title: LA 2028 Olympics chief 'deeply regrets' flirty emails with Ghislaine Maxwell
content: Casey Wasserman's flirty emails were among millions of files published by the US Department of Justice on Friday.

title: Watford boss Gracia resigns after three months
content: Javi Gracia resigns as Watford manager after just over three months in job.

title: Bartley becomes Livingston boss as Martindale moves upstairs
